sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods: x - y + 2z = 4
2x + y + 3z = 10
3x + 4y - z = -1
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods, we will first write the given system in the matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

The given system can be written as:

[1 -1 2] [x]   [ 4]
[2  1 3] [y] = [10]
[3  4 -1] [z]   [-1]

Now, we will find the inverse of matrix A and then multiply it with matrix B to get the solution matrix X.

Matrix A:
[1 -1 2]
[2  1 3]
[3  4 -1]

To find the inverse of matrix A, we will first find its determinant.

Determinant of A (|A|) = 1(1(-1) - 3(4)) - (-1)(2(-1) - 3(4)) + 2(2(4) - 1(3))
|A| = 1(-1 - 12) - (-1)(-2 - 12) + 2(8 - 3)
|A| = 1(-13) - (-1)(-14) + 2(5)
|A| = -13 - 14 + 10
|A| = -17

Since the determinant is non-zero, the inverse of matrix A exists. Now, we will find the adjoint of matrix A and then divide it by the determinant to get the inverse.

Adjoint of A:
[(-1 - 12)  -(2 - 6)  (2 - 3)] = [(-13)  4  (-1)]
[(3 - 8)  -(3 - 6)  (6 - 9)]   = [(-5)  3  (-3)]
[(4 - 3)  -(8 - 2)  (1 - 6)]   = [(1)   6  (-5)]

Now, we will find the inverse of A by dividing the adjoint of A by the determinant of A.

A^(-1) = (1/|A|) * adjoint(A)
A^(-1) = (1/-17) * [(-13)  4  (-1)]
                    [(-5)   3  (-3)]
                    [(1)    6  (-5)]

Now, we will multiply the inverse of A with matrix B to get the solution matrix X.

X = A^(-1) * B
X = (1/-17) * [(-13)  4  (-1)] [ 4]
                    [(-5)   3  (-3)] [10]
                    [(1)    6  (-5)] [-1]

X = [((-13)(4) + 4(10) - 1(-1)) / -17]
       [((-5)(4) + 3(10) - 3(-1)) / -17]
       [(1(4) + 6(10) - 5(-1)) / -17]

X = [(-52 + 40 + 1) / -17]
       [(-20 + 30 + 3) / -17]
       [(4 + 60 + 5) / -17]

X = [(-11) / -17]
       [(13) / -17]
       [(69) / -17]

X = [11/17]
       [-13/17]
       [-69/17]

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 11/17, y = -13/17, and z = -69/17.
